driver_key_placeholder.description: A concise explanation of this driver's purpose and how it influences the model.
driver_key_placeholder.justification: A brief, human-readable explanation of the reasoning behind the chosen baseline and trend values.

__metadata_definitions__.description: This section defines the valid properties for the drivers that control the projection model. The JIT Assumptions Engine's output MUST conform to these definitions.

description.purpose: A mandatory, human-readable explanation of the driver's financial meaning and its impact on the model.

baseline.purpose: The starting value for the driver, to be applied in the first projection period (T+1). This value is generated by the LLM based on its analysis of historical data.

justification.purpose: A mandatory, AI-generated rationale explaining the choice of the baseline and trend values. This is critical for model auditability and traceability.

trends.purpose: Defines the single, constant value the driver will take during each subsequent, hardcoded forecast horizon.

short_term.description: The value to be used for projection years 2 and 3.

medium_term.description: The value to be used for projection years 4 through 9.

terminal.description: The value to be used for all projection years from 10 onwards.
